metadata.title: CVE-2023-6228 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was found in the tiffcp utility distributed by the libtiff packagewhere a crafted TIFF file on processing may cause a heap-based bufferoverflow leads to an application crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6228` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.10+esm5').
libtk-img package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
povray package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
